# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia function that solves this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting all characters to lower case, then removing any leading or trailing white spaces using `strip` function. The `replace` function is used to replace all spaces and hyphens with underscores (_). This function can be tested on the provided data "My Column" as follows:

```julia
println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Outputs: my_column
```
